description.narrative: Comprehensive Disaster Management Programme II (2010 – 2014) aims to institutionalize the adoption of risk reduction approaches, not just in its host Ministry of Food and Disaster Management, but more broadly across key ministries and agencies.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Number of rules and guidelines drafted towards implementation of Disaster Management (DM) Act 2012 [1 point for each drafted] 2. Number of school textbooks (class III to XII) that have incorporated disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation contents 3. Progress on establishing local risk financing mechanism to support reduction of community level risk [Scale 0-4; 1 for Guideline drafted, 2 for approved by the Ministry, 3 for vetted by the Law Ministry, 4 for Approved by the Government] 4. Number of training and education institutions that include disaster risk reduction into their regular curriculum (The activity monitored by this indicators was closed in 2014) 5. Number of Risk reduction and adaptation small interventions implemented under "Local Disaster Risk Reduction Fund" 6. Number of visits to the Disaster Management E-library/ per year
